items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: East Sussex, Kent, Surrey, West Sussex

items.message:
Flooding is possible in this area.

Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.
This alert was issued in error due to a spike in data.

items.message: The tides continue to fall and no further impacts are expected.

items.description: Tidal River Avon at Bristol, Pill and Shirehampton

floodArea.county: City of Bristol, North Somerset, South Gloucestershire

items.description: The River Bure, Spixworth Beck and surrounding Becks
items.message: Water levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast for the next few days is unsettled and could see further rainfall which may cause some localised reaction in rivers. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

floodArea.county: Barking and Dagenham, Essex, Greater London, Havering

items.message:
The flood forecast has changed significantly. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in this area.
River levels are now returning to normal.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
